alert.note: Alert for Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 5:56PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wilcox County through 630 PM CDT... At 555 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles west of Dannelly Reservoir, or 11 miles north of Camden, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Camden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
